News.Title: Setubandhan Infrastructure Unable to Submit Q3 Reports
News.Summary: Setubandhan Infrastructure Limited cannot submit quarterly compliance reports for Q3 FY26 due to ongoing CIRP proceedings and non-payment of fees to depositories and RTA by previous management.

News.Title: Setubandhan Infrastructure Unable to Submit Regulatory Compliance Reports Due to Ongoing Insolvency Process
News.Summary: Setubandhan Infrastructure Limited informed stock exchanges that it cannot submit required compliance reports for the quarter ended September 30, 2025. The company has been under Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process since November 28, 2022, after State Bank of India filed an application. The National Company Law Tribunal rejected a resolution plan in March 2025, and an appeal has been filed with NCLAT in July 2025. Due to non-payment of outstanding fees by previous management, depositories NSDL, CDSL and the Registrar and Transfer Agent have stopped providing shareholding data. The company cannot submit shareholding patterns, reconciliation reports, compliance certificates, and investor complaint reports. However, the company is exempted from filing corporate governance reports under SEBI regulations due to its insolvency status.
